title: Boy, 10, narrowly escapes death after attack by a metre-long grouper in northern Queensland
text:
A 10-year old boy is lucky to be alive after he was attacked by a fish measuring more than a metre at a local swimming spot.

The youngster was grabbed and dragged underwater by a grouper in northern Queensland late last month.

The fish let him go shortly after, in what the town's Mayor has dubbed a 'lucky escape' for him and a 'wake up call' for local authorities.

'From talking to the mother he dragged him under and let him go. He was very lucky,' Mayor Eddie Newman told the Courier Mail.

A 10-year-old boy was bitten and dragged underwater by a metre-long grouper in northern Queensland

The boy was reportedly taken to hospital with lacerations to his body and suffering from the shock of the attack.

Mayor Newman said the fish in question was well known to locals, but this was the first he had heard of it attacking a human.

'This is the first time [it has attacked] and with the school holidays and kids jumping off the wharf and [the children] are actually swimming under the wharf, which is a new one for us,' he said.
description: A 10-year old boy is lucky to be alive after he was attacked by a fish measuring more than a metre at a local swimming spot.
authors: Hannah Moore For Daily Mail Australia
